item.title: Personal Cloud
item.description:
Introduction

Setting up a server can sound like a pretty daunting task. You may hear things like “containerization”, “Kubernetes/K8s”, and “Docker”, and immediately think that owning and maintaining a server is beyond your paygrade. Well, I’m here to tell you that it’s not, and to prove that I will get you from nothing to a fully functional Dropbox replacement with Nextcloud.

Disclaimer: This guide assumes that you have basic knowledge of how to use Linux terminal commands. If you need some help, here’s a quick cheatsheet.
